author: Eric Morath
title: Labor Department to Test Voluntary Reporting for Wage Violators
text:
Employers who have violated minimum-wage and overtime laws will be able to voluntarily report those infractions to the federal government and avoid civil penalties under a pilot program announced by the Labor Department Tuesday.
The nationwide, 6-month pilot program is aimed at encouraging employers to audit their books to look for potential violations of the Fair Labor Standards Act. If such violations are found, businesses will have to pay workers wages they are owed but wonâ€™t be subject to fines and could avoid litigation.
